arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا
phonetic: 76.1 Hal 'Atá `Alá Al-'Insāni Ĥīnun Mina Ad-Dahri Lam Yakun Shay'āan Madhkūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Has there not been over man a period of time, when he was not a thing worth mentioning?
translations.english_rwwad: Was there not a period of time when man was not a thing [even] mentioned?

arabic_text: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
phonetic: 76.2 'Innā Khalaqnā Al-'Insāna Min Nuţfatin 'Amshājin Nabtalīhi Faja`alnāhu Samī`āan Başīrāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1811]- i.e., a combination of the male and female substance, within the womb.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture[1811] that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We have created man from Nutfah (drops) of mixed semen (sexual discharge of man and woman), in order to try him: so We made him hearer and seer.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We created man from a drop of mixed fluids, in order to test him. So We gave him hearing and sight.

arabic_text: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
phonetic: 76.3 'Innā Hadaynāhu As-Sabīla 'Immā Shākirāan Wa 'Immā Kafūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We showed him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We showed him the way, whether he is grateful or ungrateful.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا
phonetic: 76.4 'Innā 'A`tadnā Lilkāfirīna Salāsilāan Wa 'Aghlālāan Wa Sa`īrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We have prepared for the disbelievers iron chains, iron collars, and a blazing Fire.
translations.english_rwwad: We have surely prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
phonetic: 76.5 'Inna Al-'Abrāra Yashrabūna Min Ka'sin Kāna Mizājuhā Kāfūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,[1812]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily,, the Abrâr (the pious believers of Islamic Monotheism), shall drink of a cup (of wine) mixed with (water from a spring in Paradise called) Kâfûr
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] flavored with camphor,

arabic_text: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا
phonetic: 76.6 `Aynāan Yashrabu Bihā `Ibādu Allāhi Yufajjirūnahā Tafjīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
translations.english_hilali_khan: A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allâh will drink, causing it to gush forth abundantly.
translations.english_rwwad: a spring from which Allah’s slaves will drink, which will flow as they wish.

arabic_text: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا
phonetic: 76.7 Yūfūna Bin-Nadhri Wa Yakhāfūna Yawmāan Kāna Sharruhu Mustaţīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They (are those who) fulfil (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil will be wide-spreading.
translations.english_rwwad: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will spread far and wide,

arabic_text: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
phonetic: 76.8 Wa Yuţ`imūna Aţ-Ţa`āma `Alá Ĥubbihi Miskīnāan Wa Yatīmāan Wa 'Asīrāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1813]- The meaning here may also be "out of love for Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

translations.english_saheeh: And they give food in spite of love for it[1813] to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they give food, inspite of their love for it (or for the love of Him), to the Miskîn[1] (the poor), the orphan, and the captive
translations.english_rwwad: and they give food, despite their love for it, to the needy, the orphans, and the captives,

arabic_text: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا
phonetic: 76.9 'Innamā Nuţ`imukum Liwajhi Allāhi Lā Nurīdu Minkum Jazā'an Wa Lā Shukūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: [Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Saying): "We feed you seeking Allâh’s Countenance only. We wish for no reward, nor thanks from you.
translations.english_rwwad: [saying to themselves] “We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we seek from you neither reward nor gratitude.

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا
phonetic: 76.10 'Innā Nakhāfu Min Rabbinā Yawmāan `Abūsāan Qamţarīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily, We fear from our Lord a Day, hard and distressful, that will make the faces look horrible (from extreme dislike to it)."
translations.english_rwwad: We fear from our Lord a grim and distressful Day.”

arabic_text: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا
phonetic: 76.11 Fawaqāhumu Allāhu Sharra Dhālika Al-Yawmi Wa Laqqāhum Nađratan Wa Surūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
translations.english_hilali_khan: So Allâh saved them from the evil of that Day, and gave them Nadrah (a light of beauty) and joy.
translations.english_rwwad: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day, and will grant them radiance and delight,

arabic_text: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُواْ جَنَّةٗ وَحَرِيرٗا
phonetic: 76.12 Wa Jazāhum Bimā Şabarū Jannatan Wa Ĥarīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And their recompense shall be Paradise, and silken garments, because they were patient.
translations.english_rwwad: and will reward them for their perseverance with Paradise and garments of silk.

arabic_text: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا
phonetic: 76.13 Muttaki'īna Fīhā `Alá Al-'Arā'iki Lā Yarawna Fīhā Shamsāan Wa Lā Zamharīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Reclining therein on raised thrones, they will see there neither the excessive heat of the sun, nor the excessive bitter cold, (as in Paradise there is no sun and no moon).
translations.english_rwwad: They will recline therein on adorned couches; neither feeling scorching heat nor freezing cold.

arabic_text: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا
phonetic: 76.14 Wa Dāniyatan `Alayhim Žilāluhā Wa Dhullilat Quţūfuhā Tadhlīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the shade thereof is close upon them, and the bunches of fruit thereof will hang low within their reach.
translations.english_rwwad: with shady branches spread above them, and clusters of fruit will be made within their reach.

arabic_text: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠
phonetic: 76.15 Wa Yuţāfu `Alayhim Bi'āniyatin Min Fiđđatin Wa 'Akwābin Kānat Qawārīra

translations.english_saheeh: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And amongst them will be passed round vessels of silver and cups of crystal -
translations.english_rwwad: They will be served frequently with silver vessels and crystal cups,

arabic_text: قَوَارِيرَاْ مِن فِضَّةٖ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِيرٗا
phonetic: 76.16 Qawārīra Min Fiđđatin Qaddarūhā Taqdīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Crystal-clear, made of silver. They will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).
translations.english_rwwad: crystalline goblets of silver, filled precisely as desired.

arabic_text: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
phonetic: 76.17 Wa Yusqawna Fīhā Ka'sāan Kāna Mizājuhā Zanjabīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they will be given to drink there of a cup (of wine) mixed with Zanjabîl (ginger),
translations.english_rwwad: They will be given a glass [of wine] flavored with ginger

arabic_text: عَيۡنٗا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِيلٗا
phonetic: 76.18 `Aynāan Fīhā Tusammá Salsabīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: [From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.
translations.english_hilali_khan: A spring there, called Salsabîl.
translations.english_rwwad: from a spring therein called Salsabīl.

arabic_text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا
phonetic: 76.19 Wa Yaţūfu `Alayhim Wildānun Mukhalladūna 'Idhā Ra'aytahum Ĥasibtahum Lu'ulu'uāan Manthūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And round about them will (serve) boys of everlasting youth. If you see them, you would think them scattered pearls.
translations.english_rwwad: They will be served by eternal young boys; if you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا
phonetic: 76.20 Wa 'Idhā Ra'ayta Thamma Ra'ayta Na`īmāan Wa Mulkāan Kabīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when you look there (in Paradise), you will see a delight (that cannot be imagined), and a great dominion.
translations.english_rwwad: If you were to look around, you would see bliss and a vast dominion.

arabic_text: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا
phonetic: 76.21 `Āliyahum Thiyābu Sundusin Khuđrun Wa 'Istabraqun Wa Ĥullū 'Asāwira Min Fiđđatin Wa Saqāhum Rabbuhum Sharābāan Ţahūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Their garments will be of fine green silk, and gold embroidery. They will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.
translations.english_rwwad: They will be dressed in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا
phonetic: 76.22 'Inna Hādhā Kāna Lakum Jazā'an Wa Kāna Sa`yukum Mashkūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
translations.english_hilali_khan: (And it will be said to them): "Verily, this is a reward for you, and your endeavour has been accepted."
translations.english_rwwad: [And they will be told,] “Indeed, this is your reward, and your efforts have been appreciated.”

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا
phonetic: 76.23 'Innā Naĥnu Nazzalnā `Alayka Al-Qur'āna Tanzīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’ân to you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) by stages.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’an to you in stages.

arabic_text: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا
phonetic: 76.24 Fāşbir Liĥukmi Rabbika Wa Lā Tuţi` Minhum 'Āthimāan 'Aw Kafūrāan

translations.english_saheeh: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore be patient (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) with constancy to the Command of your Lord (Allâh, by doing your duty to Him and by conveying His Message to mankind), and obey neither a sinner nor a disbeliever among them.
translations.english_rwwad: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not obey any sinner or disbeliever from among them.

arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةٗ وَأَصِيلٗا
phonetic: 76.25 Wa Adhkur Asma Rabbika Bukratan Wa 'Aşīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening
translations.english_hilali_khan: And remember the Name of your Lord every morning and afternoon [i.e. offering of the Morning (Fajr), Zuhr, and ‘Asr prayers].
translations.english_rwwad: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening,

arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا
phonetic: 76.26 Wa Mina Al-Layli Fāsjud Lahu Wa Sabbiĥhu Laylāan Ţawīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And during night, prostrate yourself to Him (i.e. the offering of Maghrib and ‘Ishâ’ prayers), and glorify Him a long night through (i.e. Tahajjud prayer).
translations.english_rwwad: and prostrate to Him at night, and glorify Him at length by night.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا
phonetic: 76.27 'Inna Hā'uulā' Yuĥibbūna Al-`Ājilata Wa Yadharūna Warā'ahum Yawmāan Thaqīlāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1814]- i.e., neglect.  The meaning may also be "leave ahead of them."

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them[1814] a grave Day.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, these (disbelievers) love the present life of this world, and put behind them a heavy Day (that will be hard).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, these [pagans] love this fleeting life and pay no heed to a heavy Day ahead of them.

arabic_text: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا
phonetic: 76.28 Naĥnu Khalaqnāhum Wa Shadadnā 'Asrahum Wa 'Idhā Shi'nā Baddalnā 'Amthālahum Tabdīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is We Who created them, and We have made them of strong built. And when We will, We can replace them with others like them with a complete replacement.
translations.english_rwwad: It is We Who created them and strengthened their build. If We will, We can replace them with others like them.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا
phonetic: 76.29 'Inna Hadhihi Tadhkiratun Faman Shā'a Attakhadha 'Ilá Rabbihi Sabīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this (Verse of the Qur’ân) is an admonition, so whosoever wills, let him take a Path to his Lord (Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who wills may take a way to his Lord.

arabic_text: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا
phonetic: 76.30 Wa Mā Tashā'ūna 'Illā 'An Yashā'a Allāhu 'Inna Allāha Kāna `Alīmāan Ĥakīmāan

translations.english_saheeh: And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But you cannot will, unless Allâh wills. Verily, Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.
translations.english_rwwad: But you cannot will unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

arabic_text: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا
phonetic: 76.31 Yudkhilu Man Yashā'u Fī Raĥmatihi Wa Až-Žālimīna 'A`adda Lahum `Adhābāan 'Alīmāan

translations.english_saheeh: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He will admit to His Mercy whom He wills and as for the Zâlimûn - (polytheists, wrong-doers) He has prepared a painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: He admits whom He wills into His mercy, but for the wrongdoers He has prepared a painful punishment.
